survey_questions.question: How does your fitness center's management establish and enforce security policies to protect member data and business operations, and how is compliance reviewed?
answer_set: We do not have formal, written security policies.
Policies exist but are not consistently enforced by management, and compliance is not formally reviewed.
Management has defined and approved key security policies. Compliance with these policies is checked periodically.

A comprehensive set of security policies is defined, approved by management, and enforced for all staff. Compliance is regularly reviewed, and the overall security approach is subject to independent review.

relevant_controls.title: Management responsibilities
relevant_controls.description: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organization.

relevant_controls.title: Independent review of information security
relevant_controls.description: The organization’s approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.

relevant_controls.title: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
relevant_controls.description: Compliance with the organization’s information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards shall be regularly reviewed.

survey_questions.question: What is your approach to managing access for members and staff, covering both physical entry to the facility and logical access to member management systems?
answer_set: Access is managed informally with physical keys or shared codes. We use shared logins for our software.
We use key cards/fobs for physical entry, but access rights are not customized (e.g., member vs. staff). Unique logins are used for software, but permissions are not restricted by role.
Formal policies control physical access (e.g., differentiating member, staff, and restricted areas) and logical access to software is based on job roles.

An integrated system manages both physical and logical access based on defined roles. The full lifecycle of identities is managed, with access rights automatically provisioned and revoked based on membership/employment status.

relevant_controls.title: Access control
relevant_controls.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.

relevant_controls.title: Identity management
relevant_controls.description: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.

relevant_controls.title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
relevant_controls.description: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and implemented.

survey_questions.question: How do you ensure that third-party service providers (e.g., member management software, payment processors, cleaning services) operate securely and protect your data?
answer_set: We select providers based on features and cost, without a formal security review.
We have informal discussions about security with some providers, but it is not a contractual requirement.
We review the security practices of critical providers and include basic security and privacy clauses in our agreements.
We have a formal process to assess the security of all key suppliers. Our agreements contain specific information security requirements that are agreed upon before services begin.

relevant_controls.title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
relevant_controls.description: Relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.

survey_questions.question: What plans are in place to ensure your gym can continue to operate and maintain security during a major disruption, such as a power outage or a failure of your primary software systems?
answer_set: We have no formal plans to handle such disruptions.
We react to disruptions as they happen. We may have data backups but do not test them. We have no plan for utility failures.
We have a documented plan for key disruptions (e.g., power, internet outage) and we perform regular, tested data backups for our member management system.

We have a tested business continuity plan. This includes procedures to maintain security during a disruption, backup power for critical systems (e.g., access control, emergency lighting), and verified data backups.

relevant_controls.title: Information security during disruption
relevant_controls.description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

relevant_controls.title: Supporting utilities
relevant_controls.description: Facilities protected from power failures and service disruptions.

survey_questions.question: How do you manage security related to your staff, from background checks before hiring to securing their access when they work remotely (e.g., a manager accessing schedules from home)?
answer_set: We do not perform background checks, and we have no security policy for remote work.
Background checks are conducted for some, but not all, roles. Remote work is allowed but there are no specific security measures enforced.
Background screening is a standard part of our hiring process for all staff. We have a formal remote working policy that requires secure access methods.

A formal screening process is applied to all personnel based on their role. We have a robust remote working policy with enforced technical controls (e.g., VPN, multi-factor authentication) for any access to member or business data from outside the facility.

relevant_controls.title: Screening
relevant_controls.description: Background verification checks on all candidates shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis, considering laws, regulations, business needs, and perceived risks.

relevant_controls.title: Remote working
relevant_controls.description: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed, or stored outside the organization’s premises.

survey_questions.question: How do you protect member and business records (digital and physical) and control the software installed on your computer systems?
answer_set: Records are not specifically protected from loss or unauthorized access. Staff can install any software on company computers.
Sensitive records are kept in locked offices, but digital records lack specific protection. Software installation is not formally managed.
We have procedures to protect physical and digital records. We also have a process to manage what software can be installed on operational systems.

Formal policies and technical controls are in place to protect all records from loss, unauthorized access, or release. The installation of all software is managed by a secure procedure, and the use of privileged administrative tools is tightly restricted and controlled.

relevant_controls.title: Protection of records
relevant_controls.description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release.

relevant_controls.title: Use of privileged utility programs
relevant_controls.description: Use of utility programs that override controls must be restricted and tightly controlled.

relevant_controls.title: Installation of software on operational systems
relevant_controls.description: Procedures must ensure secure management of software installation on systems.

survey_questions.question: How does your organization stay informed about security threats and maintain contact with relevant authorities or industry groups?
answer_set: We do not actively seek threat information or maintain such contacts.
We may hear about threats through general news but have no formal process to analyze them or established contacts.
We subscribe to some security newsletters or bulletins and have contact information for local law enforcement.

We actively maintain contact with relevant authorities (e.g., local police for physical security) and special interest groups (e.g., fitness industry associations) to stay informed about relevant physical and cyber threats.

relevant_controls.title: Contact with authorities
relevant_controls.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.

relevant_controls.title: Contact with special interest groups
relevant_controls.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.
